{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontogenic keratocyst is a type of cyst that forms in the jaw, often near the teeth. It is not typically caused by an infection, so option A is incorrect. It is a developmental cyst, meaning it forms during the development of the oral and maxillofacial region, so option B is correct. Aspiration is not typically the treatment of choice for this type of cyst, as it often requires surgical removal, so option C is incorrect. Lastly, odontogenic keratocysts are known for their high recurrence rate, so option D is incorrect.", "answer_choice": "B"}
